str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
Much, many; often.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.
To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
And, even, also, namely.
To report, publish abroad. From dia and a derivative of pheme; to report thoroughly, i.e. Divulgate.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
No longer, no more. From me and eti; no further.
To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
Clearly, openly, manifestly. Adverb from phaneros; plainly, i.e. Clearly or publicly.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Without, outside. Adverb from ek; out(-side, of doors), literally or figuratively.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Lonesome, i.e. waste.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come, go.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From all sides, on all sides. Adverb from pas; from all sides.
